original: Caṇḍasutta
analyzed: caṇḍasutta
translated: With Caṇḍa

original: Sāvatthinidānaṁ.
analyzed: sāvatthi nidāna
translated: At Sāvatthī.

original: Atha kho caṇḍo gāmaṇi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho caṇḍo gāmaṇi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:🔽“ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena midhekacco caṇḍo caṇḍotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: atha kho caṇḍaḥ gāmaṇi yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho caṇḍaḥ gāmaṇi bhagavantam etat avoca  kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhekaccaḥ caṇḍaḥ saṅkham gacchati
translated: Then Caṇḍa the village headman went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him, “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why some person is considered fierce,

original: Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena midhekacco sorato soratotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchatī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhekaccaḥ sorataḥ sorataḥ tu eva saṅkham gacchati iti
translated: and what is the cause, what is the reason why some person is considered gentle?”

original: “Idha, gāmaṇi, ekaccassa rāgo appahīno hoti.
analyzed: idha gāmaṇi ekaccassa rāgaḥ appahīnaḥ hoti
translated: “Here, headman, someone hasn’t given up greed.

original: Rāgassa appahīnattā pare kopenti, parehi kopiyamāno kopaṁ pātukaroti.
analyzed: rāgassa appahīna ttā pare kopenti parehi kopiyamānaḥ kopam pātukaroti
translated: Because of not giving up greed, they oppress others. When oppressed by them, others retaliate.

original: So caṇḍotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: saḥ caṇḍā ūtvā iva saṅkham gacchati
translated: So they’re considered fierce.

original: Doso appahīno hoti.
analyzed: doso appahīnaḥ hoti
translated: They haven’t given up hate.

original: Dosassa appahīnattā pare kopenti, parehi kopiyamāno kopaṁ pātukaroti.
analyzed: dosassa appahīna ttā pare kopenti parehi kopiyamānaḥ kopam pātukaroti
translated: Because of not giving up hate, they oppress others. When oppressed by them, others retaliate.

original: So caṇḍotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: saḥ caṇḍā ūtvā iva saṅkham gacchati
translated: So they’re considered fierce.

original: Moho appahīno hoti.
analyzed: mohaḥ appahīnaḥ hoti
translated: They haven’t given up delusion.

original: Mohassa appahīnattā pare kopenti, parehi kopiyamāno kopaṁ pātukaroti.
analyzed: mohassa appahīna ttā pare kopenti parehi kopiyamānaḥ kopam pātukaroti
translated: Because of not abandoning delusion, he provokes others and, when provoked by others, he shows anger.

original: So caṇḍotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: saḥ caṇḍā ūtvā iva saṅkham gacchati
translated: He is known as ‘fierce.’

original: Ayaṁ kho, gāmaṇi, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo yena midhekacco caṇḍo caṇḍotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: ayam kho hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhekaccaḥ caṇḍaḥ saṅkham gacchati
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause, why one is fierce and is known as ‘fierce.’

original: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekaccassa rāgo pahīno hoti.
analyzed: idha pana gāmaṇi ekaccassa rāgaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti
translated: “Here, headman, someone has abandoned lust.

original: Rāgassa pahīnattā pare na kopenti, parehi kopiyamāno kopaṁ na pātukaroti.
analyzed: rāgassa pahīna ttā pare na kopenti parehi kopiyamānaḥ kopam na pātukaroti
translated: Because of abandoning lust, he does not provoke others and, when provoked by others, he does not show anger.

original: So soratotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: saḥ soratotvā iva saṅkham gacchati
translated: He is known as ‘gentle.’

original: Doso pahīno hoti.
analyzed: dosaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti
translated: He has abandoned hatred.

original: Dosassa pahīnattā pare na kopenti, parehi kopiyamāno kopaṁ na pātukaroti.
analyzed: dosassa pahīna ttā pare na kopenti parehi kopiyamānaḥ kopam na pātukaroti
translated: Because of abandoning hatred, he does not provoke others and, when provoked by others, he does not show anger.

original: So soratotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: saḥ soratotvā iva saṅkham gacchati
translated: He is known as ‘gentle.’

original: Moho pahīno hoti.
analyzed: mohaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti
translated: He has abandoned delusion.

original: Mohassa pahīnattā pare na kopenti, parehi kopiyamāno kopaṁ na pātukaroti.
analyzed: mohassa pahīna ttā pare na kopenti parehi kopiyamānaḥ kopam na pātukaroti
translated: Because of abandoning delusion, he does not provoke others and, when provoked by others, he does not show anger.

original: So soratotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: saḥ soratotvā iva saṅkham gacchati
translated: He is known as ‘gentle.’

original: Ayaṁ kho, gāmaṇi, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena midhekacco sorato soratotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchatī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhekaccaḥ sorataḥ sorataḥ tu eva saṅkham gacchati iti
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause, why one is gentle and is known as ‘gentle.’”

original: Evaṁ vutte, caṇḍo gāmaṇi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte caṇḍaḥ gāmaṇi bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the village chief Caṇḍo said to the Blessed One,

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.🔽Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante  sā iyyathā api bhante nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: “Magnificent, lord! Magnificent!

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,

original: evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: in the same way has the Blessed One—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.

original: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: “I go to the Blessed One for refuge, to the Dhamma, & to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.🔽Paṭhamaṁ.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 42.2
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti  paṭhama  sayutta nikāya
translated: May the Blessed One remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge from this day forward, for life.”

original: 1. Gāmaṇivagga
analyzed: gāmaṇi vagga
translated: The first section for recitation on Caṇḍa the village chief is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Village Chiefs, .🔽The Section with Caṇḍa the Village Chief

original: Tālapuṭasutta
analyzed: tāla puṭa sutta
translated: The Palm-leaf Bowl

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: At one time the Blessed One was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

original: Atha kho tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho tālapuṭaḥ naṭagāmaṇi yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho tālapuṭaḥ naṭagāmaṇi bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then the troupe headman Tālapuṭa went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante, pubbakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ naṭānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante pubbakānam ācariya pācariyānam naṭānam bhāsamānānam
translated: “Sir, I’ve heard it said by former troupe members of ours, who were reliable and knowledgeable, that

original: ‘yo so naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe saccālikena janaṁ hāseti rameti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā pahāsānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjatī’ti.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ naṭaḥ raṅga majjhe sa majja majjhe sacca alikena janam hāseti rameti saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā pahāsānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati iti
translated: ‘the actor who entertains and amuses people with true stories is reborn in the company of the laughing gods after death.’

original: Idha bhagavā kimāhā”ti?
analyzed: bhagavān kim āha ati
translated: What does the Buddha say about this?”

original: “Alaṁ, gāmaṇi, tiṭṭhatetaṁ. Mā maṁ etaṁ pucchī”ti.
analyzed: ala tiṭṭhata ita mā mama etam pucchi iti
translated: “Enough, headman, let it be. Don’t ask me that.”

original: Dutiyampi kho tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho tālapuṭaḥ naṭagāmaṇi bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: A second time Tālapuṭa said,

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante, pubbakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ naṭānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante pubbakānam ācariya pācariyānam naṭānam bhāsamānānam
translated: “Sir, I’ve heard it said by former troupe members of ours, who were reliable and knowledgeable, that

original: ‘yo so naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe saccālikena janaṁ hāseti rameti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā pahāsānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjatī’ti.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ naṭaḥ raṅga majjhe sa majja majjhe sacca alikena janam hāseti rameti saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā pahāsānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati iti
translated: “When an actor entertains and amuses people with true speech in the middle of the theatre or assembly, then with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with the joyous gods.’

original: Idha bhagavā kimāhā”ti?
analyzed: bhagavān kim āha ati
translated: What does the Buddha say about this?”

original: “Alaṁ, gāmaṇi, tiṭṭhatetaṁ. Mā maṁ etaṁ pucchī”ti.
analyzed: ala tiṭṭhata ita mā mama etam pucchi iti
translated: “Enough, headman, let it be. Don’t ask me that.”

original: Tatiyampi kho tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho tālapuṭaḥ naṭagāmaṇi bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: A third time, Tālapuṭa said to the Buddha,

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante, pubbakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ naṭānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante pubbakānam ācariya pācariyānam naṭānam bhāsamānānam
translated: “Master Gotama, I have heard it said by actors of the past, the actors of old:

original: ‘yo so naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe saccālikena janaṁ hāseti rameti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā pahāsānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjatī’ti.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ naṭaḥ raṅga majjhe sa majja majjhe sacca alikena janam hāseti rameti saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā pahāsānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati iti
translated: ‘When an actor entertains and amuses people with true speech in the middle of the theatre or assembly, then with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with the joyous gods.’

original: Idha bhagavā kimāhā”ti?
analyzed: bhagavān kim āha ati
translated: What does Master Gotama say about this?”

original: “Addhā kho tyāhaṁ, gāmaṇi, na labhāmi:
analyzed: addhā khalu tyāha gāmaṇi na labhāmi
translated: “Headman, I certainly don’t get it when you say,

original: ‘alaṁ, gāmaṇi, tiṭṭhatetaṁ,
analyzed: ala tiṭṭhata ita
translated: ‘Enough, headman, let it be.

original: mā maṁ etaṁ pucchī’ti.
analyzed: mā mama etam pucchi iti
translated: Don’t ask me that.’

original: Api ca tyāhaṁ byākarissāmi.
analyzed: api ca tyā aham byākarissāmi
translated: But still I will answer you.

original: Pubbe kho, gāmaṇi, sattā avītarāgā rāgabandhanabaddhā.
analyzed: pubbe kho gāmaṇi sattāḥ a vīta rāgāḥ rāga bandhana baddhāḥ
translated: Headman, in the past beings were free from passion, unbound by passion.

original: Tesaṁ naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe ye dhammā rajanīyā te upasaṁharati bhiyyoso mattāya.
analyzed: tesam naṭaḥ raṅga majjhe samajja majjhe ye dhammā rajanīyā te upasaharati bhiyyosaḥ mattāya
translated: The actor, in the middle of the theatre, in the middle of the crowd, presents things that are lustful to an even greater degree.

original: Pubbe kho, gāmaṇi, sattā avītadosā dosabandhanabaddhā.🔽Tesaṁ naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe ye dhammā dosanīyā te upasaṁharati bhiyyoso mattāya.
analyzed: pubbe kho gāmaṇi sattāḥ a vīta dosāḥ dosa bandhana baddhāḥ  tesam naṭaḥ raṅga majjhe samajja majjhe ye dhammā dosanīyā te upasaharati bhiyyosaḥ mattāya
translated: In the past, people were not free from passion, bound by the fetters of passion.🔽The actor, in the middle of the theatre, in the middle of the crowd, presents things that are hateful to an even greater degree.

original: Pubbe kho, gāmaṇi, sattā avītamohā mohabandhanabaddhā.🔽Tesaṁ naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe ye dhammā mohanīyā te upasaṁharati bhiyyoso mattāya.
analyzed: pubbe kho gāmaṇi sattāḥ a vīta mohāḥ moha bandhana baddhāḥ  tesam naṭaḥ raṅga majjhe samajja majjhe ye dhammā mohanīyā te upasaharati bhiyyosaḥ mattāya
translated: In the past, people were not free from delusion, bound by the fetters of delusion.🔽The actor, in the middle of the theatre, in the middle of the crowd, presents things that are deluding to an even greater degree.

original: So attanā matto pamatto pare madetvā pamādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā pahāso nāma nirayo tattha upapajjati.
analyzed: so attanā mattaḥ pamattaḥ pare madetvā pamādetvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā pahāsaḥ nāma nirayaḥ tattha upapajjati
translated: He himself is intoxicated and heedless, and he intoxicates and makes others heedless. When his body breaks up, after death, he is reborn in the laughing hell.

original: Sace kho panassa evaṁdiṭṭhi hoti:
analyzed: sace kho panassa evadiṭṭhi hoti
translated: But if he has the view:

original: ‘yo so naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe saccālikena janaṁ hāseti rameti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā pahāsānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjatī’ti, sāssa hoti micchādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ naṭaḥ raṅga majjhe sa majja majjhe sacca alikena janam hāseti rameti saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā pahāsānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati iti sā assa hoti micchādiṭṭhi
translated: ‘The actor, in the middle of the theatre, in the middle of the crowd, entertains and delights people with a true story, when his body breaks up, after death, is reborn in companionship with the laughing gods,’ this is his wrong view.

original: Micchādiṭṭhikassa kho panāhaṁ, gāmaṇi, purisapuggalassa dvinnaṁ gatīnaṁ aññataraṁ gatiṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhikassa kho pana āha gāmaṇi purisa puggalassa dvinnam gatīnam aññataram gatim vadāmi
translated: I say that a person with wrong view has these two destinations:

original: nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā”ti.
analyzed: nirayam vā tiracchānayonim vāti
translated: hell or the animal realm.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi parodi assūni pavattesi.
analyzed: evam vutte tālapuṭaḥ parodi assūni pavattesi
translated: When this was said, the actor Tālapuṭa wept and shed tears.

original: “Etaṁ kho tyāhaṁ, gāmaṇi, nālatthaṁ:
analyzed: etam khalu tya aha gāmaṇi na alattha
translated: “I didn’t get this from you, headman:

original: ‘alaṁ, gāmaṇi, tiṭṭhatetaṁ; mā maṁ etaṁ pucchī’”ti.
analyzed: ala tiṭṭhata ita mā mama etam pucchi iti
translated: ‘Enough, headman. Let it be. Don’t ask me that.’”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhante, etaṁ rodāmi yaṁ maṁ bhagavā evamāha;
analyzed: na aha bhante etam rodāmi yam mam bhagavān evam āha
translated: “I’m not crying because the Buddha said this to me.

original: api cāhaṁ, bhante, pubbakehi ācariyapācariyehi naṭehi dīgharattaṁ nikato vañcito paluddho:
analyzed: api ca āha bhante pubbakehi ācariya pācariyehi naṭehi dīgharattam nikataḥ vañcitaḥ paluddhaḥ
translated: But, Sir, for a long time I’ve been deceived, cheated, and fooled by my teacher’s teachers, the actors of old,

original: ‘yo so naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe saccālikena janaṁ hāseti rameti so kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā pahāsānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjatī’”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ naṭaḥ raṅga majjhe sa majja majjhe sacca alikena janam hāseti rameti saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā pahāsānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati iti
translated: who said that an actor who entertains people with true speech is reborn in companionship with the laughing gods when his body breaks up and his life ends.”

original: “Abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante
translated: “Excellent, Sir! Excellent!🔽It’s as if someone were to set up what had been knocked down,

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: sā iyyathā api bhante nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: or to point out the way to one who had got lost,🔽or to bring an oil-lamp into a dark place,🔽so that those with eyes could see what was there.

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: or to show a person to one born blind, or to hold up an oil-lamp in a dark place so that those with eyes can see forms,

original: evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: so too the Blessed One has by many a figure revealed the Dhamma.

original: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: Venerable sir, I go to the Blessed One for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Labheyyāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.
analyzed: labheyya āha bhante bhagavato santike pabbajja labheyyam upasampadanti
translated: Venerable sir, may I receive the going forth under the Blessed One, may I receive the full admission?”

original: Alattha kho tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: alattha kho tālapuṭaḥ naṭagāmaṇi bhagavato santike pabbajja alattha upasampada
translated: Tālapuṭa the troupe headman received the going forth under the Blessed One, he received the full admission.

original: Acirūpasampanno ca panāyasmā tālapuṭo …pe…
analyzed: acira upasampannaḥ ca pana āyasmā tāla puṭaḥ
translated: And soon, not long after his full admission,🔽dwelling alone, withdrawn, diligent, ardent, and resolute, the venerable Tālapuṭa, by realising for himself with direct knowledge, here and now entered upon and abided in that supreme goal of the holy life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

analyzed: yaḥ saḥ bhante purisaḥ musā vādī rattiyāḥ vā divasassa vā samaya asamayam upādāya appataraḥ saḥ samayaḥ yam saḥ musā bhaṇati atha kho su eva bahutaraḥ samayaḥ yam saḥ musā na bhaṇati iti
translated: “The time he was lying, telling falsehoods, would be less, venerable sir, than the time he was not lying, telling falsehoods.”

original: “‘Yaṁbahulaṁ yaṁbahulañca, gāmaṇi, viharati tena tena nīyatī’ti, evaṁ sante na koci āpāyiko nerayiko bhavissati, yathā nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa vacanaṁ.
analyzed: ya bahulam ya bahulam ca viharati tena tena nīyati iti evam sante na koci āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ bhavissati yathā nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa
translated: “If that is so, then no one will be bound for the states of deprivation, the bad destinations, hell, as the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta says.

original: Idha, gāmaṇi, ekacco satthā evaṁvādī hoti evaṁdiṭṭhi:🔽‘yo koci pāṇamatipāteti, sabbo so āpāyiko nerayiko, yo koci adinnaṁ ādiyati, sabbo🔽so āpāyiko nerayiko, yo koci kāmesu micchā carati, sabbo so āpāyiko nerayiko, yo
analyzed: idha gāmaṇi ekaccaḥ satthā eva vādī hoti eva diṭṭhi  yaḥ koci pāṇam atipāteti sabbaḥ saḥ āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ yaḥ koci adinnam ādiyati sabbaḥ  so āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ yaḥ koci kāmesu micchā carati sabbo so āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ yo
translated: There is the case where a certain teacher holds this doctrine, this view:

original: koci musā bhaṇati, sabbo so āpāyiko nerayiko’ti.🔽Tasmiṁ kho pana, gāmaṇi, satthari sāvako abhippasanno hoti.
analyzed: koci musā bhaṇati sabbo so āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ ti  tasmin kho pana gāmaṇi satthari sāvakaḥ abhippasannaḥ hoti
translated: ‘Everyone who kills a living creature… Everyone who takes what is not given… Everyone who engages in sensual misconduct… Everyone who speaks falsely… is headed for a state of woe, headed for hell.’

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: And a disciple has confidence in that teacher, thinking:

original: ‘mayhaṁ kho satthā evaṁvādī evaṁdiṭṭhi—🔽yo koci pāṇamatipāteti, sabbo so āpāyiko nerayikoti.
analyzed: mayham kho satthā eva vādī eva diṭṭhi  yaḥ koci pāṇam atipāteti sabbo so āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ ti
translated: ‘Surely, this Blessed One is capable of teaching me the Dhamma in such a way that I might come to know & see for myself: “This is that principle of discernment through which, in regard to this body with’s its perceptions & forms, its six-fold sense media, its seven stations of consciousness, its dependence on two,1 the extent of the round is shown, the extent of the search, the extent of the destination of the round, the extent of the destination of the search.”

original: Atthi kho pana mayā pāṇo atipātito, ahampamhi āpāyiko nerayikoti diṭṭhiṁ paṭilabhati.
analyzed: atthi kho pana mayā pāṇaḥ atipātito ahampamhi āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ iti diṭṭhim paṭilabhati
translated: But there is a living being that I have killed. I am headed for a state of woe, headed for hell.’

original: Taṁ, gāmaṇi, vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā yathābhataṁ nikkhitto evaṁ niraye.
analyzed: vācam appahāya tam cittam appahāya tam diṭṭhim appaṭinissajjitvā yathābhatam nikkhittaḥ evam niraye
translated: Not abandoning that speech, not relinquishing that state of mind, not making himself understand the Dhamma, he is cast down to hell.

original: Mayhaṁ kho satthā evaṁvādī evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: mayham kho satthā eva vādī eva diṭṭhi
translated: My teacher holds this doctrine, this view:

original: yo koci adinnaṁ ādiyati, sabbo so āpāyiko nerayikoti.🔽Atthi kho pana mayā adinnaṁ ādinnaṁ ahampamhi āpāyiko nerayikoti diṭṭhiṁ paṭilabhati.
analyzed: yaḥ koci adinnam ādiyati sabbo saḥ āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ ti  atthi kho pana mayā adinnam ādinnam ahampamhi āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ iti diṭṭhim paṭilabhati
translated: Whoever takes what is not given is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.’🔽But I have taken what is not given.🔽I’m irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.’

original: Taṁ, gāmaṇi, vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā yathābhataṁ nikkhitto evaṁ niraye.
analyzed: vācam appahāya tam cittam appahāya tam diṭṭhim appaṭinissajjitvā yathābhatam nikkhittaḥ evam niraye
translated: If you don’t give up that speech, that thought, and that view, then you’re finished, just finished, I say, if you keep on insisting.

original: Mayhaṁ kho satthā evaṁvādī evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: mayham kho satthā eva vādī eva diṭṭhi
translated: My teacher says this and holds this view:

original: yo koci kāmesu micchā carati, sabbo so āpāyiko nerayiko’ti.
analyzed: yaḥ koci kāmesu micchā carati sabbo so āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ ti
translated: Whoever engages in sexual activity is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.’

original: Atthi kho pana mayā kāmesu micchā ciṇṇaṁ.🔽‘Ahampamhi āpāyiko nerayiko’ti diṭṭhiṁ paṭilabhati.
analyzed: atthi kho pana mayā kāmesu micchā  āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ iti diṭṭhim paṭilabhati
translated: But I have engaged in sexual activity.🔽I’m irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.’

original: Taṁ, gāmaṇi, vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā yathābhataṁ nikkhitto evaṁ niraye.
analyzed: vācam appahāya tam cittam appahāya tam diṭṭhim appaṭinissajjitvā yathābhatam nikkhittaḥ evam niraye
translated: If you don’t give up that speech, that thought, and that view, then you’re finished, just finished, I say, if you keep on insisting.

original: Mayhaṁ kho satthā evaṁvādī evaṁdiṭṭhi—
analyzed: mayham kho satthā eva vādī eva diṭṭhi
translated: My teacher says this and holds this view:

original: yo koci musā bhaṇati, sabbo so āpāyiko nerayikoti.
analyzed: yaḥ koci musā bhaṇati sabbo saḥ āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ ti
translated: Whoever speaks falsehood is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.’

original: Atthi kho pana mayā musā bhaṇitaṁ.
analyzed: atthi kho pana mayā musā bhaṇita
translated: But I have spoken falsehood.

original: ‘Ahampamhi āpāyiko nerayiko’ti diṭṭhiṁ paṭilabhati.
analyzed: āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ iti diṭṭhim paṭilabhati
translated: he acquires the view: ‘I am destined to an unhappy destiny, to hell.’

original: Taṁ, gāmaṇi, vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā yathābhataṁ nikkhitto evaṁ niraye.
analyzed: vācam appahāya tam cittam appahāya tam diṭṭhim appaṭinissajjitvā yathābhatam nikkhittaḥ evam niraye
translated: Without abandoning that speech, without abandoning that thought, without abandoning that view, as he is, so he goes to hell.

original: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā.
analyzed: idha pana gāmaṇi tathāgataḥ loke uppajjati araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā
translated: “Here, headman, a Tathagata appears in the world, accomplished, fully enlightened …

original: So anekapariyāyena pāṇātipātaṁ garahati vigarahati, ‘pāṇātipātā viramathā’ti cāha.
analyzed: saḥ aneka pariyāyena pāṇātipātam garahati vigarahati pāṇātipātāḥ viramatha iti ca āha
translated: He reproves the killing of living beings in many ways …

original: Adinnādānaṁ garahati vigarahati, ‘adinnādānā viramathā’ti cāha.🔽Kāmesumicchācāraṁ garahati, vigarahati ‘kāmesumicchācārā viramathā’ti cāha.
analyzed: a dinna ādānam garahati vigarahati a dinna ādānāḥ viramatha iti ca āha  kāmesum icchā ācāram garahati vigarahati kāmesum icchā ācārāḥ viramatha ati ca āha
translated: He reproves taking what is not given …🔽He reproves misconduct in sensual pleasures …

original: Musāvādaṁ garahati vigarahati ‘musāvādā viramathā’ti cāha.
analyzed: musāvādam garahati vigarahati musāvādāḥ viramatha iti ca āha
translated: He reproves false speech in many ways …

original: Tasmiṁ kho pana, gāmaṇi, satthari sāvako abhippasanno hoti.
analyzed: tasmin kho pana gāmaṇi satthari sāvakaḥ abhippasannaḥ hoti
translated: Now, headman, a disciple has confidence in that teacher thus:

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He considers thus:

original: ‘bhagavā kho anekapariyāyena pāṇātipātaṁ garahati vigarahati, pāṇātipātā viramathāti cāha.
analyzed: bhagavā kho aneka pariyāyena pāṇātipātam garahati vigarahati pāṇātipātāḥ viramatha iti ca āha
translated: ‘In many ways the Buddha has criticized killing living creatures and has censured it, saying: “Don’t kill living creatures.”

original: Atthi kho pana mayā pāṇo atipātito yāvatako vā tāvatako vā.
analyzed: atthi kho pana mayā pāṇaḥ atipātitaḥ yāvatakaḥ vā tāvatakaḥ vā
translated: But I have killed living creatures.🔽That was not right, it was not good.

original: Yo kho pana mayā pāṇo atipātito yāvatako vā tāvatako vā, taṁ na suṭṭhu, taṁ na sādhu.🔽Ahañceva kho pana tappaccayā vippaṭisārī assaṁ.
analyzed: yaḥ kho pana mayā pāṇaḥ atipātitaḥ yāvatakaḥ vā tāvatakaḥ vā tam na suṭṭhu tam na sādhu  aham ca iva kho pana tad paccayā vippaṭisārī assa
translated: If I were to feel remorse,

original: Na metaṁ pāpaṁ kammaṁ akataṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: na me tat pāpam kammam a katam bhavissati iti
translated: that bad action would not be done by me.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya tañceva pāṇātipātaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: sā u iti paṭisaṅkhāya tat ca iva pāṇa atipātam pajahati
translated: Reflecting like this, he gives up killing living creatures.

original: Āyatiñca pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti.🔽Evametassa pāpassa kammassa pahānaṁ hoti.
analyzed: āyatim ca pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti  evam etassa pāpassa kammassa pahānam hoti
translated: In the future he doesn’t kill living creatures.🔽This is how there is the abandoning of that bad action.

original: Evametassa pāpassa kammassa samatikkamo hoti.
analyzed: evam etassa pāpassa kammassa samatikkamaḥ hoti
translated: This is how there is the transcending of that bad action.

original: ‘Bhagavā kho anekapariyāyena adinnādānaṁ garahati vigarahati, adinnādānā viramathāti cāha.
analyzed: bhagavā kho aneka pariyāyena adinnādānam garahati vigarahati adinnādānāḥ viramatha iti ca āha
translated: ‘In many ways the Buddha has criticized stealing and has censured it, saying: “Don’t steal.”

original: Atthi kho pana mayā adinnaṁ ādinnaṁ yāvatakaṁ vā tāvatakaṁ vā.
analyzed: atthi kho pana mayā adinnam ādinnam yāvatakam vā tāvatakam vā
translated: But I have stolen.

original: Yaṁ kho pana mayā adinnaṁ ādinnaṁ yāvatakaṁ vā tāvatakaṁ vā taṁ na suṭṭhu, taṁ na sādhu.
analyzed: yam kho pana mayā adinnam ādinnam yāvatakam vā tāvatakam vā tam na suṭṭhu tam na sādhu
translated: Whatever I have taken that was not given, whether of ten pennies’ worth or a hundred, was not right, it was not good.

original: Ahañceva kho pana tappaccayā vippaṭisārī assaṁ, na metaṁ pāpaṁ kammaṁ akataṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana tad paccayā vippaṭisārī assa na me etat pāpam kammam a katam bhavissati iti
translated: If I were to feel remorse, that would not be fitting.

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya tañceva adinnādānaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: sā u iti paṭisaṅkhāya tat ca iva adinnādānam pajahati
translated: So, reflecting carefully, he gives up that taking of what is not given.

original: Āyatiñca adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti.🔽Evametassa pāpassa kammassa pahānaṁ hoti.
analyzed: āyatim ca a dinna ādānā paṭivirataḥ hoti  evam etassa pāpassa kammassa pahānam hoti
translated: In the future he abstains from taking what is not given.🔽That is how there is the abandoning of that bad deed.

original: Evametassa pāpassa kammassa samatikkamo hoti.🔽‘Bhagavā kho pana anekapariyāyena kāmesumicchācāraṁ garahati vigarahati, kāmesumicchācārā viramathāti cāha.
analyzed: evam etassa pāpassa kammassa samatikkamaḥ hoti  bhagavā khalu pana aneka pariyāyena kāmesum icchā ācāram garahati vigarahati kāmesum icchā ācārāḥ viramatha ati ca āha
translated: That is how there is the surmounting of that bad deed.

original: Atthi kho pana mayā kāmesu micchā ciṇṇaṁ yāvatakaṁ vā tāvatakaṁ vā.
analyzed: atthi kho pana mayā kāmesu micchā ciṇṇam yāvatakam vā tāvatakam vā
translated: ‘The Blessed One, in many a figure, has declared the evil, the corruption, of sexual misconduct. He has condemned sexual misconduct, and has taught the abandoning of sexual misconduct.🔽But I have committed sexual misconduct.

original: Yaṁ kho pana mayā kāmesu micchā ciṇṇaṁ yāvatakaṁ vā tāvatakaṁ vā taṁ na suṭṭhu, taṁ na sādhu.
analyzed: yam kho pana mayā kāmesu micchā ciṇṇam yāvatakam vā tāvatakam vā tam na suṭṭhu tam na sādhu
translated: Whatever sexual misconduct I have committed was not right, it was not good.

original: Ahañceva kho pana tappaccayā vippaṭisārī assaṁ, na metaṁ pāpaṁ kammaṁ akataṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana tad paccayā vippaṭisārī assa na me etat pāpam kammam a katam bhavissati iti
translated: If I were to regret it, that bad kamma would not have been done.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya tañceva kāmesumicchācāraṁ pajahati, āyatiñca kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti.
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisaṅkhāya tam ca iva kāmesum icchācāram pajahati āyatim ca kāmesum icchācārā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: Reflecting thus, he abandons that misconduct in sensual pleasures and abstains from it in the future.

original: Evametassa pāpassa kammassa pahānaṁ hoti.
analyzed: evam etassa pāpassa kammassa pahānam hoti
translated: This is how there is the abandoning of that bad kamma, its destruction, termination, and future non-arising.

original: Evametassa pāpassa kammassa samatikkamo hoti.
analyzed: evam etassa pāpassa kammassa samatikkamaḥ hoti
translated: This is how there is the surmounting of that bad kamma.

original: ‘Bhagavā kho pana anekapariyāyena musāvādaṁ garahati vigarahati, musāvādā viramathāti cāha.
analyzed: bhagavā khalu pana aneka pariyāyena musāvādam garahati vigarahati musāvādāḥ viramatha iti ca āha
translated: ‘The Blessed One, in many a figure, has declared lying to be an evil, a corruption, a defilement, a stain, a stain on moral habit, a bad thing, and he has censured it in many a figure.

original: Atthi kho pana mayā musā bhaṇitaṁ yāvatakaṁ vā tāvatakaṁ vā.
analyzed: atthi kho pana mayā musā bhaṇitam yāvatakam vā tāvatakam vā
translated: And I have lied, to whatever extent.

original: Yaṁ kho pana mayā musā bhaṇitaṁ yāvatakaṁ vā tāvatakaṁ vā taṁ na suṭṭhu, taṁ na sādhu. Ahañceva kho pana tappaccayā vippaṭisārī assaṁ, na metaṁ pāpaṁ kammaṁ akataṁ bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: yam kho pana mayā musā bhaṇitam yāvatakam vā tāvatakam vā tam na suṭṭhu tam na sādhu aham ca iva kho pana tad paccayā vippaṭisārī assa na me etam pāpam kammam a katam bhavissati iti
translated: If I were to regret it, that bad kamma would not have been done.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya tañceva musāvādaṁ pajahati, āyatiñca musāvādā paṭivirato hoti.
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisaṅkhāya tam ca iva musāvādam pajahati āyatim ca musāvādā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: Reflecting thus, he abandons that false speech and abstains from it in the future.

original: Evametassa pāpassa kammassa pahānaṁ hoti. Evametassa pāpassa kammassa samatikkamo hoti.
analyzed: evam etassa pāpassa kammassa pahānam hoti evam etassa pāpassa kammassa samatikkamaḥ hoti
translated: That is how there is an abandoning of that evil deed, how there is an exterminating of it.

original: So pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti.🔽Adinnādānaṁ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti.
analyzed: saḥ pāṇa atipātam pahāya pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti  a dinna ādānam pahāya a dinna ādānā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: He, having abandoned the destruction of life, abstains from the destruction of life.🔽Having abandoned the taking of what is not given, he abstains from taking what is not given.

original: Kāmesumicchācāraṁ pahāya kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti.🔽Musāvādaṁ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato hoti.🔽Pisuṇaṁ vācaṁ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti.
analyzed: kāmesum icchā ācāram pahāya kāmesum icchā ācārā paṭivirataḥ hoti  musāvādam pahāya musāvādā paṭivirataḥ hoti  pisuṇam vācam pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: Having abandoned unchastity, he abstains from unchastity.🔽Having abandoned false speech, he abstains from false speech.🔽Having abandoned malicious speech, he abstains from malicious speech.

original: Pharusaṁ vācaṁ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti.🔽Samphappalāpaṁ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti.🔽Abhijjhaṁ pahāya anabhijjhālu hoti.
analyzed: pharusam vācam pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ hoti  samphappalāpam pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirataḥ hoti  abhijjham pahāya an abhijjhālu hoti
translated: Having abandoned harsh speech, he abstains from harsh speech.🔽Having abandoned gossip, he abstains from gossip.🔽Having abandoned covetousness, he is uncovetous.

original: Byāpādappadosaṁ pahāya abyāpannacitto hoti.
analyzed: byāpāda ppadosam pahāya a byāpanna cittaḥ hoti
translated: Having abandoned ill-will and hatred, he has a mind without ill-will.

original: Micchādiṭṭhiṁ pahāya sammādiṭṭhiko hoti.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhim pahāya sammādiṭṭhikaḥ hoti
translated: Having abandoned wrong views, he has right views.

original: Sa kho so, gāmaṇi, ariyasāvako evaṁ vigatābhijjho vigatabyāpādo asammūḷho sampajāno
analyzed: sa kho saḥ gāmaṇi ariya sāvakaḥ evam vigata abhijjhaḥ vigata byāpādaḥ asammūḷhaḥ sampajānaḥ
translated: That noble disciple, headman, being thus free from longing and free from ill-will, unconfused, clearly comprehending,

original: paṭissato mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā🔽tatiyaṁ, tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ
analyzed: paṭissataḥ mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā tathā  tatiya tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya
translated: and to the third direction, and to the fourth direction, and above, and below, and across (all around);

original: lokaṁ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
analyzed: lokam mettā sahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena a byāpajjena pharitvā viharati
translated: making the measureless and boundless mind free of enmity and ill will, he dwells pervading the entire world, upwards, downwards, across, and everywhere, everywhere equally,

original: Seyyathāpi, gāmaṇi, balavā saṅkhadhamo appakasireneva catuddisā viññāpeyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api gāmaṇi balavā saṅkha dhamaḥ appa kasirena iva catuddisā viññāpeyya
translated: just as a strong man might blow a small conch shell, so would he make his voice heard in the four directions.

original: evameva kho, gāmaṇi, evaṁ bhāvitāya mettāya cetovimuttiyā evaṁ bahulīkatāya yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ, na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evam eva kho gāmaṇi evam bhāvitāya mettāya cetaḥ vimuttiyāḥ evam bahulīkatāya yam pamāṇa katam kamma na tam tatra avasissati na tam tatra avatiṭṭhati
translated: Even so, headman, when the mind-deliverance of loving-kindness is developed in this way, no limited (amount of) action that he performs by body, speech, or mind can remain without result.

original: Sa kho so, gāmaṇi, ariyasāvako evaṁ vigatābhijjho vigatabyāpādo asammūḷho sampajāno paṭissato karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
analyzed: sa kho saḥ gāmaṇi ariya sāvakaḥ evam vigata abhijjhaḥ vigata byāpādaḥ asammūḷhaḥ sampajānaḥ paṭissataḥ karuṇā sahagatena cetasā pe
translated: Then, headman, that noble disciple, being free from longing and ill will, unconfused, clearly comprehending, ever mindful, dwells pervading one quarter with a mind full of compassion …

original: muditāsahagatena cetasā …pe….
analyzed: muditā sahagatena cetasā pe
translated: with a mind full of sympathetic joy …

original: Upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā tatiyaṁ,🔽tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā dutiya tathā tatiya  tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam upekkhā sahagatena
translated: He dwells, suffusing the first direction with a mind filled with equanimity, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth;

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena a byāpajjena pharitvā viharati
translated: so above, below, and across, everywhere, in all ways, he dwells, suffusing the entire world with a mind filled with equanimity, extensive, developed, measureless, free from hatred and ill will.

original: Seyyathāpi, gāmaṇi, balavā saṅkhadhamo appakasireneva catuddisā viññāpeyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api gāmaṇi balavā saṅkha dhamaḥ appa kasirena iva catuddisā viññāpeyya
translated: Just as if a mighty trumpeter were with little difficulty to make a proclamation to the four quarters,

original: evameva kho, gāmaṇi, evaṁ bhāvitāya upekkhāya cetovimuttiyā evaṁ bahulīkatāya yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhatī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho gāmaṇi evam bhāvitāya upekkhāya cetaḥ vimuttiyā evam bahulīkatāya yam pamāṇa katam kammam na tam tatra avasissati na tam tatra avatiṭṭhati iti
translated: so too, when the liberation of mind by equanimity is developed in this way, whatever action he performs with his body, whatever action he performs with his speech, and whatever action he performs with his mind, his mind is inclined to that kind of action.

original: Evaṁ vutte, asibandhakaputto gāmaṇi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte asibandhaka puttaḥ gāmaṇi bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the headman Asibandhakaputta said to the Blessed One:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante …pe…
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante pe
translated: “Magnificent, venerable sir! Magnificent, venerable sir! The Blessed One has made the Dhamma clear in many ways, as though he were turning upright what had been overthrown, revealing what was hidden, showing the way to one who is lost, or holding up a lamp in the dark for those with eyesight to see forms.🔽Venerable sir, I go to the Blessed One for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May the Blessed One remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: Aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhama
translated: The eighth chapter

original: Saṁyutta Nikāya 42.9
analyzed: sayutta nikāya
translated: The Connected Discourses with Devadatta

original: 1. Gāmaṇivagga
analyzed: gāmaṇi vagga
translated: 1. The Chapter with Village Chiefs

original: Kulasutta
analyzed: kula sutta
translated: Families

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena nāḷandā tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena nāḷandā tat avasari
translated: One day the Buddha was wandering in the Kosalan country with a large sangha of monks when he arrived at a town called Nāḷandā.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā nāḷandāyaṁ viharati pāvārikambavane.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā nāḷandāyam viharati pāvārikamba vane
translated: He stayed in Nāḷandā in the Pāvādika’s Mango Grove.

original: Tena kho pana samayena nāḷandā dubbhikkhā hoti dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena nāḷandā dubbhikkhā hoti dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā
translated: At that time Nāḷandā was short of food and afflicted with hunger, so that almsfood was difficult to obtain.

original: Tena kho pana samayena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto nāḷandāyaṁ paṭivasati mahatiyā nigaṇṭhaparisāya saddhiṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto nāḷandāyam paṭivasati mahatiyā nigaṇṭha parisāya saddhi
translated: At that time the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta was staying in Nāḷandā with a large following of Nigaṇṭhas.

original: Atha kho asibandhakaputto gāmaṇi nigaṇṭhasāvako yena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto tenupasaṅkami;
analyzed: atha kho asibandhakaputtaḥ gāmaṇi nigaṇṭha sāvakaḥ yena nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then Asibandhakaputta the village chief, a disciple of the Nigaṇṭhas, went to the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta,

original: upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭhaṁ nāṭaputtaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭham nāṭa puttam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinna
translated: bowed, sat down,

original: kho asibandhakaputtaṁ gāmaṇiṁ nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto etadavoca:
analyzed: kho asibandhakaputtam gāmaṇim nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa puttaḥ etat avoca
translated: and the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta said to him,

original: “ehi tvaṁ, gāmaṇi, samaṇassa gotamassa vādaṁ āropehi.
analyzed: ehi tva gāmaṇi samaṇassa gotamassa vādam āropehi
translated: “Come, village chief, refute the ascetic Gotama’s doctrine.

original: Evaṁ te kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchissati:
analyzed: evam te kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggacchissati
translated: In this way your good reputation will spread:

original: ‘asibandhakaputtena gāmaṇinā samaṇassa gotamassa evaṁmahiddhikassa evaṁmahānubhāvassa vādo āropito’”ti.
analyzed: asibandhaka puttena gāmaṇinā samaṇassa gotamassa eva mahiddhikassa eva mahā anubhāvassa vādaḥ āropito ti
translated: ‘The headman Asibandhakaputta has challenged the mighty and powerful recluse Gotama to debate.’

original: “Kathaṁ panāhaṁ, bhante, samaṇassa gotamassa evaṁmahiddhikassa evaṁmahānubhāvassa vādaṁ āropessāmī”ti?
analyzed: katham pana āha bhante samaṇassa gotamassa eva mahiddhikassa eva mahā anubhāvassa vādam āropessāmi iti
translated: “But how, venerable sir, can I challenge the mighty and powerful recluse Gotama to debate?”

original: “Ehi tvaṁ, gāmaṇi, yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ vadehi:
analyzed: ehi tva gāmaṇi yena samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā samaṇam gotamam evam vadehi
translated: “Come, headman, approach the recluse Gotama and say to him:

original: ‘nanu, bhante, bhagavā anekapariyāyena kulānaṁ anuddayaṁ vaṇṇeti, anurakkhaṁ vaṇṇeti, anukampaṁ vaṇṇetī’ti?
analyzed: nanu bhante bhagavā aneka pariyāyena kulānam anuddayam vaṇṇeti anurakkham vaṇṇeti anukampam vaṇṇeti iti
translated: ‘Venerable sir, does the Blessed One not describe in many ways the non-afflicting, the harmless, and the comforting of families?’

original: Sace kho, gāmaṇi, samaṇo gotamo evaṁ puṭṭho evaṁ byākaroti:
analyzed: sace kho gāmaṇi samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ evam puṭṭhaḥ evam byākaroti
translated: If the recluse Gotama answers you thus:

original: ‘evaṁ, gāmaṇi, tathāgato anekapariyāyena kulānaṁ anuddayaṁ vaṇṇeti, anurakkhaṁ vaṇṇeti, anukampaṁ vaṇṇetī’ti, tamenaṁ tvaṁ evaṁ vadeyyāsi:
analyzed: eva gāmaṇi tathāgataḥ aneka pariyāyena kulānam anuddayam vaṇṇeti anurakkham vaṇṇeti anukampam vaṇṇeti iti tam enam tvam evam vadeyyāsi
translated: ‘Headman, the Tathagata describes in many ways the non-afflicting, the harmless, and the comforting of families,’ then you should reply:

original: ‘atha kiñcarahi, bhante, bhagavā dubbhikkhe dvīhitike setaṭṭhike salākāvutte mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ cārikaṁ carati?
analyzed: atha kiñcarahi bhante bhagavā dubbhikkhe dvīhitike setaṭṭhike salākāvutte mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim cārikam carati
translated: ‘Well then, how is it that the Buddha is wandering on tour with a large Sangha of bhikkhus at a time of famine, when crops have failed and harvests have been blighted by drought?

original: Ucchedāya bhagavā kulānaṁ paṭipanno, anayāya bhagavā kulānaṁ paṭipanno, upaghātāya bhagavā kulānaṁ paṭipanno’ti.
analyzed: ucchedāya bhagavā kulānam paṭipannaḥ anayāya bhagavā kulānam paṭipannaḥ upaghātāya bhagavā kulānam paṭipannaḥ iti
translated: The Buddha is practising for the destruction of families, for the ruin of families, for the detriment of families.’

original: Imaṁ kho te, gāmaṇi, samaṇo gotamo ubhatokoṭikaṁ pañhaṁ puṭṭho neva sakkhati uggilituṁ, neva sakkhati ogilitun”ti.
analyzed: imam kho te gāmaṇi samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ubhatokoṭikam pañham puṭṭhaḥ na iva sakkhati uggilitu na iva sakkhati ogilitunti
translated: When asked a question about the two extremes, the recluse Gotama is unable to get out, unable to escape.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho asibandhakaputto gāmaṇi nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa paṭissutvā🔽uṭṭhāyāsanā nigaṇṭhaṁ nāṭaputtaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami;
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho asibandhakaputtaḥ gāmaṇi nigaṇṭhassa nāṭa puttassa paṭissutvā  uṭṭhāya āsanā nigaṇṭham nāṭa puttam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami
translated: “Yes, venerable sir,” the steward Asibandhakaputta replied.🔽He rose from his seat, and after paying homage to the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta, keeping him on his right, he left to see the Blessed One.

original: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho asibandhakaputto🔽gāmaṇi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho asibandhaka putto 🔽gāmaṇi bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When he had approached the Blessed One, he paid homage to him, sat down to one side,🔽and reported his entire conversation with the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta.

original: “Nanu, bhante, bhagavā anekapariyāyena kulānaṁ anuddayaṁ vaṇṇeti, anurakkhaṁ vaṇṇeti, anukampaṁ vaṇṇetī”ti?
analyzed: nanu bhante bhagavā aneka pariyāyena kulānam anuddayam vaṇṇeti anurakkham vaṇṇeti anukampam vaṇṇeti iti
translated: “But, Reverend Sir, doesn’t the Blessed One praise non-violence, compassion, and sympathy for families?”

original: “Evaṁ, gāmaṇi, tathāgato anekapariyāyena kulānaṁ anuddayaṁ vaṇṇeti, anurakkhaṁ vaṇṇeti, anukampaṁ vaṇṇetī”ti.
analyzed: eva gāmaṇi tathāgataḥ aneka pariyāyena kulānam anuddayam vaṇṇeti anurakkham vaṇṇeti anukampam vaṇṇeti iti
translated: “Yes, headman, the Tathāgata does praise non-violence, compassion, and sympathy for families.”

original: “Atha kiñcarahi, bhante, bhagavā dubbhikkhe dvīhitike setaṭṭhike salākāvutte mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ cārikaṁ carati?
analyzed: atha kiñcarahi bhante bhagavā dubbhikkhe dvīhitike setaṭṭhike salākāvutte mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim cārikam carati
translated: “Then why, Reverend Sir, does the Blessed One wander about with a large community of monks during a famine, a time of scarcity, when crops are blighted, and people are starving, when even alms-food is difficult to obtain?

original: Ucchedāya bhagavā kulānaṁ paṭipanno, anayāya bhagavā kulānaṁ paṭipanno, upaghātāya bhagavā kulānaṁ paṭipanno”ti.🔽“Ito so, gāmaṇi, ekanavutikappe yamahaṁ anussarāmi, nābhijānāmi kiñci kulaṁ pakkabhikkhānuppadānamattena upahatapubbaṁ.
analyzed: ucchedāya bhagavā kulānam paṭipannaḥ anayāya bhagavā kulānam paṭipannaḥ upaghātāya bhagavā kulānam paṭipannaḥ iti  itas so gāmaṇi ekanavuti kappe yam aham anussarāmi na abhijānāmi kiñci kulam pakka bhikkhā an uppadāna mattena upahata pubba
translated: The Blessed One is practicing for the destruction of families, for their ruin and downfall.”🔽“Headman, I remember ninety-one previous generations of kings, who were called Mahāsammata, and the people who lived in their time.

original: Atha kho yāni tāni kulāni aḍḍhāni mahaddhanāni mahābhogāni pahūtajātarūparajatāni
analyzed: atha khalu yāni tāni kulāni aḍḍhāni mahat dhanāni mahā bhogāni pahūta jātarūpa rajatāni
translated: There were no families that were ruined by the offering of almsfood.

original: pahūtavittūpakaraṇāni pahūtadhanadhaññāni, sabbāni tāni dānasambhūtāni ceva saccasambhūtāni
analyzed: pahūta vittu upakaraṇāni pahūta dhana dhaññāni sabbāni tāni dāna sambhūtāni ca iva sacca sambhūtāni
translated: and they have abundant wealth and corn, all that is due to giving, truth,

original: ca sāmaññasambhūtāni ca.
analyzed: ca sāmañña sambhūtāni ca
translated: and celibacy.

original: Aṭṭha kho, gāmaṇi, hetū, aṭṭha paccayā kulānaṁ upaghātāya.
analyzed: aṭṭha kho gāmaṇi hetū aṭṭha paccayāḥ kulānam upaghātāya
translated: “There are eight reasons, eight causes for the decline of families.

original: Rājato vā kulāni upaghātaṁ gacchanti, corato vā kulāni upaghātaṁ gacchanti, aggito🔽vā kulāni upaghātaṁ gacchanti, udakato vā kulāni upaghātaṁ gacchanti, nihitaṁ vā
analyzed: rājataḥ vā kulāni upaghātam gacchanti corataḥ vā kulāni upaghātam gacchanti aggitaḥ  vā kulāni upaghātam gacchanti udakataḥ vā kulāni upaghātam gacchanti nihitam vā
translated: Families decline through kings, through thieves, through fire,🔽through floods, through bad investments,

original: ṭhānā vigacchati, duppayuttā vā kammantā vipajjanti, kule vā kulaṅgāroti uppajjati,
analyzed: ṭhānā vigacchati duppayuttāḥ vā kammantāḥ vipajjanti kule vā kulaṅgāraḥ ti uppajjati
translated: through bad wives, or a family member is born who is dissolute and wasteful,

original: yo te bhoge vikirati vidhamati viddhaṁseti, aniccatāyeva aṭṭhamīti.🔽Ime kho, gāmaṇi, aṭṭha hetū, aṭṭha paccayā kulānaṁ upaghātāya.
analyzed: yaḥ te bhoge vikirati vidhamati viddha seti anicca tāya iva aṭṭhamīti  ime kho gāmaṇi aṭṭha hetū aṭṭha paccayāḥ kulānam upaghātāya
translated: who squanders, destroys, and dissipates his wealth. The eighth is impermanence.🔽These are the eight reasons, eight causes for the decline of families.

original: Imesu kho, gāmaṇi, aṭṭhasu hetūsu, aṭṭhasu paccayesu saṁvijjamānesu yo maṁ evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: imesu kho gāmaṇi aṭṭhasu hetūsu aṭṭhasu paccayesu sa vijjamānesu yaḥ mama evam vadeyya
translated: When these eight reasons, eight causes for the decline of families are found,🔽if anyone were to say:

original: ‘ucchedāya bhagavā kulānaṁ paṭipanno, anayāya bhagavā kulānaṁ paṭipanno, upaghātāya bhagavā kulānaṁ paṭipanno’ti,
analyzed: ucchedāya bhagavā kulānam paṭipannaḥ anayāya bhagavā kulānam paṭipannaḥ upaghātāya bhagavā kulānam paṭipannaḥ iti
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord is intent on the destruction of families, on the ruin of families, on the hurt of families!’🔽If he does not abandon that statement, that thought, that intention, then he will go to the Nether Regions.

original: taṁ, gāmaṇi, vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā yathābhataṁ nikkhitto evaṁ niraye”ti.
analyzed: vācam appahāya tam cittam appahāya tam diṭṭhim appaṭinissajjitvā yathābhatam nikkhittaḥ evam niraya iti
translated: Without giving up that speech, that thought, and that view, he will go to hell.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, asibandhakaputto gāmaṇi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte asibandhaka puttaḥ gāmaṇi bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the village chief Ashi-Bandha-Kapa said to the Lord:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante …pe…
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante pe
translated: ‘Excellent, Lord, excellent! …

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.🔽Navamaṁ.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti  navama
translated: From this day forth may the Lord remember me as a lay-follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.’

original: Saṁyutta Nikāya 42.10
analyzed: sayutta nikāya
translated: The ninth section on village chiefs is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Village Chiefs, .

original: 1. Gāmaṇivagga
analyzed: gāmaṇi vagga
translated: The Chapter on Village Chiefs

original: Maṇicūḷakasutta
analyzed: maṇicūḍaka sutta
translated: With Manicunda

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: At one time the Lord was staying at Rajagaha in the Bamboo Grove in the squirrels’ feeding ground.

original: Tena kho pana samayena rājantepure rājaparisāya sannisinnānaṁ sannipatitānaṁ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena rājantepure rāja parisāya sannisinnānam sannipatitānam ayam antarākathā udapādi
translated: Now at that time, in the royal palace, this conversation arose among the assembled ministers:

original: “kappati samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtiyānaṁ jātarūparajataṁ, sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṁ, paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajatan”ti.🔽Tena kho pana samayena maṇicūḷako gāmaṇi tassaṁ parisāyaṁ nisinno hoti.
analyzed: kappati samaṇānam sakyaputtiyānam jātarūpa rajata sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyāḥ jātarūpa rajata paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyāḥ jātarūpa rajatanti  tena kho pana samayena maṇicūḷakaḥ gāmaṇi tassam parisāyam nisinno hoti
translated: “Gold and silver are allowable to the Sakyan monastics. The Sakyan monastics consent to gold and silver. The Sakyan monastics receive gold and silver.”🔽On that occasion the village overseer Maṇicūḷaka was sitting in that assembly.

original: Atha kho maṇicūḷako gāmaṇi taṁ parisaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu maṇicūḍakaḥ gāmaṇi tam parisam etat avoca
translated: He said to the assembly,

original: “mā ayyo evaṁ avacuttha.
analyzed: mā ayyaḥ evam avacuttha
translated: “Don’t say that.

original: Na kappati samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtiyānaṁ jātarūparajataṁ, na sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā🔽jātarūparajataṁ, nappaṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṁ, nikkhittamaṇisuvaṇṇā
analyzed: na kappati samaṇānam sakyaputtiyānam jātarūpa rajata na sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā  jātarūpa rajata na paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakya puttiyā jātarūpa rajata nikkhitta maṇi suvaṇṇā

original: samaṇā sakyaputtiyā apetajātarūparajatā”ti.

analyzed: asakkhi kho maṇicūḷakaḥ gāmaṇi tam parisam saññāpetu
translated: But he was unable to convince that assembly.

original: Atha kho maṇicūḷako gāmaṇi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho maṇicūḷako gāmaṇi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu maṇicūḷakaḥ gāmaṇi yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu maṇicūḷakaḥ gāmaṇi bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to him:

original: “idha, bhante, rājantepure rājaparisāya sannisinnānaṁ sannipatitānaṁ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
analyzed: idha bhante rājantepure rāja parisāya sannisinnānam sannipatitānam ayam antarākathā udapādi
translated: “Venerable sir, while we were sitting together in the royal palace, this conversation arose among us:

original: ‘kappati samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtiyānaṁ jātarūparajataṁ, sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṁ, paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajatan’ti.
analyzed: kappati samaṇānam sakyaputtiyānam jātarūpa rajata sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyāḥ jātarūpa rajata paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyāḥ jātarūpa rajatanti
translated: ‘Gold and silver are allowable to the Sakyan monastics; the Sakyan monastics consent to gold and silver; the Sakyan monastics accept gold and silver.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, bhante, taṁ parisaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte aha bhante tam parisam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, I said to them:

original: ‘mā ayyo evaṁ avacuttha.🔽Na kappati samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtiyānaṁ jātarūparajataṁ, na sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā
analyzed: mā ayyaḥ evam avacuttha  na kappati samaṇānam sakyaputtiyānam jātarūpa rajata na sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā
translated: ‘Friends, don’t say that.

original: jātarūparajataṁ, nappaṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṁ, nikkhittamaṇisuvaṇṇā
analyzed: jātarūpa rajata na paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakya puttiyā jātarūpa rajata nikkhitta maṇi suvaṇṇā
translated: Gold and silver are not allowable to the Sakyan monastics; the Sakyan monastics do not consent to gold and silver; the Sakyan monastics do not accept gold and silver. The Sakyan monastics,🔽having abandoned the acceptance of gold and silver,

original: samaṇā sakyaputtiyā apetajātarūparajatā’ti.
analyzed: samaṇā sakya puttiyāḥ
translated: that the Sakyan monastics have given up gold and silver.’

original: Asakkhiṁ khvāhaṁ, bhante, taṁ parisaṁ saññāpetuṁ.
analyzed: asakkhim khvā aha bhante tam parisam saññāpetu
translated: But I was unable to convince that assembly.

original: Kaccāhaṁ, bhante, evaṁ byākaramāno vuttavādī ceva bhagavato homi, na ca bhagavantaṁ🔽abhūtena abbhācikkhāmi, dhammassa cānudhammaṁ byākaromi, na ca koci sahadhammiko
analyzed: kaccā āha bhante evam byākaramānaḥ vutta vādī ca iva bhagavataḥ homi na ca  abhūtena abbhācikkhāmi dhammassa ca anudhammam byākaromi na ca koci sahadhammikaḥ
translated: Have I stated the Buddha’s words correctly, and not misrepresented him with an incorrect account?

original: vādānuvādo gārayhaṁ ṭhānaṁ āgacchatī”ti?
analyzed: vāda anuvādaḥ gārayham ṭhānam āgacchati iti
translated: Do I explain in accordance with the Teaching, so that no one who tries to find fault with me can legitimately do so?”

original: “Taggha tvaṁ, gāmaṇi, evaṁ byākaramāno vuttavādī ceva me hosi, na ca maṁ abhūtena
analyzed: tat ha tva gāmaṇi evam byākaramānaḥ vutta vādī ca iva me hosi na ca mama abhūtena
translated: “You have stated the Buddha’s words correctly, and not misrepresented him with an incorrect account.

original: abbhācikkhasi, dhammassa cānudhammaṁ byākarosi, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo🔽gārayhaṁ ṭhānaṁ āgacchati.🔽Na hi, gāmaṇi, kappati samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtiyānaṁ jātarūparajataṁ, na sādiyanti samaṇā
analyzed: abbhācikkhasi dhammassa ca anudhammam byākarosi na ca koci sahadhammikaḥ vāda anuvādaḥ  gārayham ṭhānam āgacchati  na hi kappati samaṇānam sakyaputtiyānam na sādiyanti samaṇāḥ
translated: You explain in accordance with the Teaching, and no one who tries to find fault with you can legitimately do so.🔽For it’s not allowable for the Sakyan monastics to accept gold and silver.

original: sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṁ, nappaṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṁ,
analyzed: sakya puttiyāḥ jātarūpa rajata na paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakya puttiyāḥ jātarūpa rajata
translated: The Sakyan monastics don’t consent to gold and silver, they don’t receive gold and silver,

original: nikkhittamaṇisuvaṇṇā samaṇā sakyaputtiyā apetajātarūparajatā.
analyzed: nikkhitta maṇi suvaṇṇā samaṇā sakya puttiyā apeta jātarūpa rajatā
translated: The Sakyan monastics have given up gold and silver.

original: Yassa kho, gāmaṇi, jātarūparajataṁ kappati, pañcapi tassa kāmaguṇā kappanti.
analyzed: yassa kho jātarūpa rajatam kappati pañca api tassa kāmaguṇā kappanti
translated: Anyone for whom gold and silver are allowable has the five kinds of sensual stimulation as his ideal.

original: Yassa pañca kāmaguṇā kappanti (…), ekaṁsenetaṁ, gāmaṇi, dhāreyyāsi assamaṇadhammo asakyaputtiyadhammoti.
analyzed: yassa pañca kāmaguṇā kappanti dhāreyyāsi a samaṇa dhammo a sakyaputtiya dhammo ti
translated: Anyone for whom the five kinds of sensual stimulation are allowable has the whole world as his ideal. You should definitely hold that this is not the spiritual life and not a monastic of the Sakyan.”

original: Api cāhaṁ, gāmaṇi, evaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: api ca āha gāmaṇi evam vadāmi
translated: But, headman, I say this:

original: tiṇaṁ tiṇatthikena pariyesitabbaṁ, dāru dārutthikena pariyesitabbaṁ, sakaṭaṁ sakaṭatthikena pariyesitabbaṁ, puriso purisatthikena pariyesitabbo.
analyzed: tiṇam tiṇatthikena pariyesitabba dāru dārutthikena pariyesitabba sakaṭam sakaṭatthikena pariyesitabba purisaḥ purisatthikena pariyesitabbaḥ
translated: Grass is for the buying of grass, wood is for the buying of wood, a cart is for the buying of a cart, a man is for the buying of a man.

original: Na tvevāhaṁ, gāmaṇi, kenaci pariyāyena ‘jātarūparajataṁ sāditabbaṁ pariyesitabban’ti vadāmī”ti.
analyzed: na tu eva āha gāmaṇi kenacid pariyāyena jātarūpa rajatam sāditabbam pariyesitabbanti vadāmi iti
translated: But in no way do I say that gold and silver are to be accepted or sought out.”

analyzed: bhadraka sutta

translated: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Mallas’ country at the Mallian town of Uruvelakappa.

original: Atha kho bhadrako gāmaṇi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho bhadrako gāmaṇi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:

translated: Bhadraka then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: “Ahañce te, gāmaṇi, atītamaddhānaṁ ārabbha dukkhassa samudayañca atthaṅgamañca deseyyaṁ:
analyzed: aham ce te gāmaṇi atīta maddhānam ārabbha dukkhassa samudayañca atthaṅgamañca deseyya
translated: “If I were to teach you the origin and ending of suffering in relation to the past, saying,

analyzed: evam tatra te siyā kaṅkhā siyā
translated: ‘This is how it was in the past,’ you might doubt me.

original: Ahañce te, gāmaṇi, anāgatamaddhānaṁ ārabbha dukkhassa samudayañca atthaṅgamañca deseyyaṁ:
analyzed: aham ce te gāmaṇi anāgata maddhānam ārabbha dukkhassa samudayañca atthaṅgamañca deseyya

analyzed: evam bhavissati tatra api te siyā kaṅkhā siyā vimati

analyzed: atthi me bhante uruvela kappe manussāḥ yesam me vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā uppajjeyyum soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsā ati
translated: “There are, lord.”

original: “Atthi pana te, gāmaṇi, uruvelakappe manussā yesaṁ te vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā nuppajjeyyuṁ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana te gāmaṇi uruvela kappe manussāḥ yesam te vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā nuppajjeyyum soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsā ati
translated: “But are there any people in Uruvelakappa for whose slaughter, bondage, beating, or condemnation you would not experience sorrow, lamentation, pain, distress, & despair?”

original: “Atthi me, bhante, uruvelakappe manussā yesaṁ me vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā nuppajjeyyuṁ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā”ti.
analyzed: atthi me bhante uruvela kappe manussāḥ yesam me vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā nuppajjeyyum soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsā ati
translated: “There are people in Uruvelakappa whose killing, imprisonment, confiscation, and condemnation I would not be happy about.”

original: “Ko nu kho, gāmaṇi, hetu, ko paccayo yena te ekaccānaṁ uruvelakappiyānaṁ manussānaṁ vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā uppajjeyyuṁ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā”ti?

translated: “What’s the reason, headman, what’s the cause why you’re not happy about the killing, imprisonment, confiscation, and condemnation of some people in Uruvelakappa?”

original: “Yesaṁ me, bhante, uruvelakappiyānaṁ manussānaṁ vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā uppajjeyyuṁ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā, atthi me tesu chandarāgo.
analyzed: yesam me bhante uruvelakappiyānam manussānam vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā uppajjeyyum soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsāḥ atthi me tesu chanda rāgaḥ
translated: “I have desire and passion for those people whose killing, imprisonment, confiscation, and condemnation I would not be happy about.

original: Yesaṁ pana, bhante, uruvelakappiyānaṁ manussānaṁ vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā nuppajjeyyuṁ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā, natthi me tesu chandarāgo”ti.
analyzed: yesam pana bhante uruvelakappiyānam manussānam vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā nuppajjeyyum soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsāḥ natthi me tesu chanda rāgaḥ ti
translated: But I have no desire and passion for those people whose killing, imprisonment, confiscation, and condemnation I would not be unhappy about.”

original: “Iminā tvaṁ, gāmaṇi, dhammena diṭṭhena viditena akālikena pattena pariyogāḷhena atītānāgate nayaṁ nehi:
analyzed: iminā tva gāmaṇi dhammena diṭṭhena viditena akālikena pattena pariyogāḷhena atīta anāgate nayam nehi
translated: you can infer about the past:🔽‘Whatever suffering arose in the past, all that was rooted in desire,

original: ‘yaṁ kho kiñci atītamaddhānaṁ dukkhaṁ uppajjamānaṁ uppajji sabbaṁ taṁ chandamūlakaṁ chandanidānaṁ.
analyzed: yam kho kiñci atīta maddhānam dukkham uppajjamānam uppajji sabbam tam chanda mūlakam chanda nidāna
translated: had desire as its source.

original: Chando hi mūlaṁ dukkhassa.

original: Yampi hi kiñci anāgatamaddhānaṁ dukkhaṁ uppajjamānaṁ uppajjissati, sabbaṁ taṁ chandamūlakaṁ chandanidānaṁ.
analyzed: yat api hi kiñci anāgata maddhānam dukkham uppajjamānam uppajjissati sabbam tam chanda mūlakam chanda nidāna
translated: will have desire as its source.

original: Chando hi mūlaṁ dukkhassā’”ti.
analyzed: chandaḥ hi mūlam dukkhassa ati
translated: Desire is the root of suffering.’

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante.

translated: “It’s astounding and amazing, lord,

translated: has desire as its source.

original: Chando hi mūlaṁ dukkhassā’ti.🔽Atthi me, bhante, ciravāsī nāma kumāro bahi āvasathe paṭivasati.
analyzed: chandaḥ hi mūlam dukkhassa ati  atthi me bhante ciravāsī nāma kumāraḥ bahi āvasathe paṭivasati
translated: Desire is the root of suffering.’🔽Lord, I have a young boy named Ciravāsi who lives in an outer residence.

original: So khvāhaṁ, bhante, kālasseva vuṭṭhāya purisaṁ uyyojemi:
analyzed: saḥ khvā aha bhante kālassa iva vuṭṭhāya purisam uyyojemi
translated: Lord, I get up early in the morning and send a man, saying,

translated: ‘Go and find out about the young man Ciravāsi.’

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhante, so puriso nāgacchati, tassa me hoteva aññathattaṁ:
analyzed: bhante saḥ purisaḥ na āgacchati tassa me hotā iva

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, gāmaṇi,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi gāmaṇi
translated: “What do you think, headman?

translated: If the young man Ciravāsi were to be executed, imprisoned, fined, or censured, would sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair arise in you?”

analyzed: cira vāsissa me bhante kumārassa vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā jīvitassa pi siyā aññathatta kim pana me nuppajjissanti soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsā ati  iminā api kho pariyāyena veditabba
translated: “If the young man Ciravāsi were to be executed, imprisoned, fined, or censured, I would be subject to sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair.”

analyzed: yat kiñci dukkham uppajjamānam uppajjati sabbam tam chanda mūlakam chanda nidāna
translated: “In this way too, headman, it can be understood how all stress that arises is rooted in desire.

translated: Before you saw and heard your mother, did you have any desire, passion, or love for her?”

original: “No hetaṁ, bhante”.🔽“Dassanaṁ vā te, gāmaṇi, āgamma savanaṁ vā evaṁ te ahosi:
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante  dassanam vā te gāmaṇi āgamma savanam vā evam te ahosi

original: ‘ciravāsimātuyā chando vā rāgo vā pemaṁ vā’”ti?
