analyzed: yvā ayam satthā eva vādī eva diṭṭhi
translated: who teaches thus, who instructs thus, who has such a view, who has such a doctrine and discipline,🔽who teaches such a path and practice—that teacher is surely right, not wrong.🔽Even if one were to commit murder, theft, sexual misconduct, false speech,🔽or drink alcohol, one would not be doing wrong.

original: “karoto kārayato, chindato chedāpayato, pacato pācāpayato, socayato socāpayato, kilamato
analyzed: karotaḥ kārayataḥ chindataḥ chedāpayataḥ pacataḥ pācāpayataḥ socayataḥ socāpayataḥ kilamataḥ
translated: Even if one were to go forth in his teaching, one would not be doing wrong.🔽Even if one were to go forth in his teaching and then engage in sexual activity,🔽 Translation: In the same way he pervades the second direction, the third direction, the fourth direction,🔽the four intermediate directions, above and below, all around, everywhere. With a mind filled with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility or ill will, he dwells pervading the entire world.🔽He considers thus:🔽‘That teacher whose doctrine is thus,

original: kilamāpayato, phandato phandāpayato, pāṇamatipātayato, adinnaṁ ādiyato, sandhiṁ chindato,
analyzed: kilamāpayataḥ phandataḥ phandāpayataḥ pāṇam atipātayataḥ adinnam ādiyataḥ sandhim chindataḥ
translated: who teaches thus, who instructs thus, who has such a view, who has such a doctrine and discipline,🔽who teaches such a path and practice—that teacher is surely right, not wrong.

original: nillopaṁ harato, ekāgārikaṁ karoto, paripanthe tiṭṭhato, paradāraṁ gacchato, musā
analyzed: nillopam harato ekāgārikam karoto paripanthe tiṭṭhato paradāram gacchato musā
translated: Even if one were to commit murder, theft, sexual misconduct, false speech,

original: bhaṇato, karoto na karīyati pāpaṁ.🔽Khurapariyantena cepi cakkena yo imissā pathaviyā pāṇe ekaṁ maṁsakhalaṁ ekaṁ maṁsapuñjaṁ kareyya, natthi tatonidānaṁ pāpaṁ, natthi pāpassa āgamo.
analyzed: bhaṇato na pāpa 🔽khura pariyantena cepi cakkena yaḥ imissā pathaviyā pāṇe ekam masa khalam ekam masa puñjam kareyya natthi tatonidānam pāpa natthi pāpassa āgamaḥ
translated: or drink alcohol, one would not be doing wrong.

original: Dakkhiṇañcepi gaṅgāya tīraṁ gaccheyya hananto ghātento chindanto chedāpento pacanto pācāpento, natthi tatonidānaṁ pāpaṁ, natthi pāpassa āgamo.
analyzed: dakkhiṇam ce pi gaṅgāya tīram gaccheyya hanantaḥ ghātentaḥ chindantaḥ chedāpentaḥ pacantaḥ pācāpentaḥ natthi tatonidānam pāpa natthi pāpassa āgamaḥ
translated: If you were to go along the southern bank of the Ganges killing, making others kill, cutting, making others cut, torturing, making others torture, there would be no evil from that cause, no evil would come of it.

original: Uttarañcepi gaṅgāya tīraṁ gaccheyya dadanto dāpento, yajanto yajāpento, natthi tatonidānaṁ puññaṁ, natthi puññassa āgamo.
analyzed: uttaram ce pi gaṅgāya tīram gaccheyya dadantaḥ dāpentaḥ yajantaḥ yajāpentaḥ natthi tatonidānam puñña natthi puññassa āgamo
translated: If you were to go along the northern bank of the Ganges giving, making others give, sacrificing, making others sacrifice, there would be no merit from that cause, no merit would come of it.

original: Dānena damena saṁyamena saccavajjena natthi puññaṁ, natthi puññassa āgamo”ti.
analyzed: dānena damena sayamena saccavajjena natthi puñña natthi puññassa āgamaḥ ti
translated: There is no merit, there is no merit to be got from giving, from sacrifice, from offering, from virtue, from austerities.’

original: Sace tassa bhoto satthuno saccaṁ vacanaṁ, apaṇṇakatāya mayhaṁ, yvāhaṁ na kiñci byābādhemi tasaṁ vā thāvaraṁ vā?
analyzed: sace tassa bhoto satthuno saccam apaṇṇaka tāya yvā aham na kiñci tasam vā thāvaram vā
translated: If my teacher’s words are true, then I am lost, for I do not harm anything that is timid or безобщаskbnoe.

original: Ubhayamettha kaṭaggāho, yaṁ camhi kāyena saṁvuto vācāya saṁvuto manasā saṁvuto, yañca kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjissāmī’ti.🔽Tassa pāmojjaṁ jāyati.
analyzed: ubhayam ettha kaṭaggāhaḥ yam camhi kāyena savutaḥ vācāya savutaḥ manasā savutaḥ yam ca kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjissāmi iti  tassa pāmojjam jāyati
translated: Both of these are a dead end, that I should be restrained in body, speech, and mind, and that on the dissolution of the body, after death, I should reappear in a happy state, in heaven.🔽Joy arises in him.

original: Pamuditassa pīti jāyati.
analyzed: pamuditassa pīti jāyati
translated: When he is joyful, rapture arises.

original: Pītimanassa kāyo passambhati.
analyzed: pīti manassa kāyo passambhati
translated: When the mind is uplifted by rapture the body becomes tranquil.

original: Passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vedayati.
analyzed: passaddha kāyaḥ sukham vedayati
translated: with a peaceful body he feels pleasure.

original: Sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
analyzed: sukhinaḥ cittam
translated: One who is pleased, his mind becomes concentrated.

original: Ayaṁ kho, gāmaṇi, dhammasamādhi
analyzed: ayam kho gāmaṇi dhamma samādhi
translated: This is the concentration of mind through the Dhamma.

original: tatra ce tvaṁ cittasamādhiṁ paṭilabheyyāsi, evaṁ tvaṁ imaṁ kaṅkhādhammaṁ pajaheyyāsi.
analyzed: tatra ce tvam citta samādhim paṭilabheyyāsi evam tvam imam kaṅkhā dhammam pajaheyyāsi
translated: If you were to obtain concentration of mind there, then you could abandon that state of indecision.

original: Sa kho so, gāmaṇi, ariyasāvako evaṁ vigatābhijjho vigatabyāpādo asammūḷho sampajāno
analyzed: sa kho saḥ gāmaṇi ariya sāvakaḥ evam vigata abhijjhaḥ vigata byāpādaḥ asammūḷhaḥ sampajānaḥ
translated: Then, headman, that noble disciple, being free from longing and ill-will, unconfused, clearly comprehending,

original: paṭissato mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā🔽tatiyaṁ, tathā catutthaṁ, iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ
analyzed: paṭissataḥ mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā tathā  tatiya tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya
translated: dwells pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, likewise the second quarter, the third quarter, and the fourth quarter.

original: lokaṁ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
analyzed: lokam mettā sahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena a byāpajjena pharitvā viharati
translated: Thus above, below, across, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he dwells pervading the entire world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, vast, exalted, measureless, without hostility, without ill-will.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:🔽‘yvāyaṁ satthā evaṁvādī evaṁdiṭṭhi:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati  yvā ayam satthā eva vādī eva diṭṭhi
translated: He considers thus:🔽‘This teacher had such a view and such a belief:

original: “karoto kārayato, chindato chedāpayato, pacato pācāpayato, socayato socāpayato, kilamato
analyzed: karotaḥ kārayataḥ chindataḥ chedāpayataḥ pacataḥ pācāpayataḥ socayataḥ socāpayataḥ kilamataḥ
translated: “By this practice, by this conduct, by this negligence, by this wrong path, these sentient beings have fallen to a bad destiny, to the animal realm.”

original: kilamāpayato, phandato phandāpayato, pāṇamatipātayato, adinnaṁ ādiyato, sandhiṁ chindato,🔽nillopaṁ harato, ekāgārikaṁ karoto, paripanthe tiṭṭhato, paradāraṁ gacchato, musā
analyzed: kilamāpayataḥ phandataḥ phandāpayataḥ pāṇam atipātayataḥ adinnam ādiyataḥ sandhim chindataḥ  nillopam harato ekāgārikam karoto paripanthe tiṭṭhato paradāram gacchato musā
translated: of one who tires out, of one who makes another tire out, of one who kills living beings, of one who takes what has not been given, of one who breaks into a house,🔽of one who plunders, of one who commits burglary, of one who commits highway robbery, of one who goes to another’s wife, of one who speaks falsehood,

original: bhaṇato, karoto karīyati pāpaṁ.
analyzed: bhaṇataḥ pāpa
translated: of one who tires out, of one who makes another tire out, of one who kills, of one who makes another kill, of one who takes what is not given, of one who makes another take what is not given, of one who breaks into houses, of one who plunders the contents of villages or the contents of towns or the contents of countries, of one who commits highway robbery, of one who makes another commit highway robbery, of one who seduces a woman, of one who makes another seduce a woman, of one who speaks falsehood, of one who makes another speak falsehood, evil is done and evil is accumulated.

original: Khurapariyantena cepi cakkena yo imissā pathaviyā pāṇe ekaṁ maṁsakhalaṁ ekaṁ maṁsapuñjaṁ kareyya, atthi tatonidānaṁ pāpaṁ, atthi pāpassa āgamo.
analyzed: khura pariyantena cepi cakkena yaḥ imissā pathaviyā pāṇe ekam masa khalam ekam masa puñjam kareyya atthi tatonidānam pāpa atthi pāpassa āgamaḥ
translated: If one were to take a razor-edged discus and make of all this land, with its towns and villages, its gardens and groves, its people and animals, one single mass of flesh, one single heap of flesh, there would be evil from that cause, there would be an accumulation of evil.

original: Dakkhiṇañcepi gaṅgāya tīraṁ gaccheyya hananto ghātento chindanto chedāpento pacanto pācāpento, atthi tatonidānaṁ pāpaṁ, atthi pāpassa āgamo.

translated: If one were to go along the southern bank of the Ganges killing, slaying, cutting, or causing to be cut, burning, or causing to be burned, there would be evil from that cause, there would be an accumulation of evil.

original: Uttarañcepi gaṅgāya tīraṁ gaccheyya dadanto dāpento, yajanto yajāpento, atthi tatonidānaṁ puññaṁ, atthi puññassa āgamo.
analyzed: uttaram ce pi gaṅgāya tīram gaccheyya dadantaḥ dāpentaḥ yajantaḥ yajāpentaḥ atthi tatonidānam puñña atthi puññassa āgamo
translated: If one were to go along the northern bank of the Ganges giving gifts, causing sacrifices to be performed, and doing meritorious deeds, there would be merit from that cause, there would be an accumulation of merit.

original: Dānena damena saṁyamena saccavajjena atthi puññaṁ atthi puññassa āgamo”ti.
analyzed: dānena damena sayamena saccavajjena atthi puñam atthi puññassa āgamaḥ ti
translated: By giving, self-control, refraining, and truthful speech there is merit, there is an accumulation of merit.”

analyzed: pamuditassa pīti jāyati  pīti manassa kāyo passambhati  passaddha kāyaḥ sukham vedayati

analyzed: sukhinaḥ cittam
translated: And when he is blissful, his mind becomes concentrated.

original: Ayaṁ kho, gāmaṇi, dhammasamādhi.
analyzed: ayam kho gāmaṇi dhamma samādhi
translated: This is called concentration by development.

translated: A noble disciple who is free of greed, free of hate, unconfused, and mindful, develops the heart’s release by compassion …

analyzed: muditā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam viharati pe
translated: He dwells, suffusing one quarter with a mind filled with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth; so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he dwells, suffusing the entire world with a mind filled with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, measureless, free from enmity, and free from affliction.

original: Sa kho so, gāmaṇi, ariyasāvako evaṁ vigatābhijjho vigatabyāpādo asammūḷho sampajāno🔽paṭissato upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā
analyzed: sa kho saḥ gāmaṇi ariya sāvakaḥ evam vigata abhijjhaḥ vigata byāpādaḥ asammūḷhaḥ sampajānaḥ  paṭissataḥ upekkhā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā tathā
translated: “Then, headman, that noble disciple, who is thus devoid of longing, devoid of ill will, unencumbered, has no fear of any kind.

translated: He dwells, suffusing one quarter with a mind filled with equanimity, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth; so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he dwells, suffusing the entire world with a mind filled with equanimity, abundant, exalted, measureless, free from enmity, and free from affliction.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He considers thus:

analyzed: yvā ayam satthā eva vādī eva diṭṭhi  natthi natthi natthi hutam natthi su kata dukkaṭānam kammānam

analyzed: vipākaḥ natthi ayam lokaḥ natthi paraḥ lokaḥ natthi mātā natthi pitā natthi sattāḥ opapātikā
translated: There is no this world or the next world. There is no mother or father. There are no spontaneously reborn beings; there is no brahman; there is no ascetic or brahmin who has attained, who has perfectly practiced, who has directly known this world and the next.”

original: natthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañca lokaṁ parañca lokaṁ🔽sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī”ti.

translated: There are no ascetics or brahmins who have realised the truth by their own super-knowledge and proclaim it —

analyzed: tatra ce tvam citta samādhim paṭilabheyyāsi evam tvam imam kaṅkhā dhammam pajaheyyāsi
translated: If you attain concentration of mind there, you can abandon this doubtful state.

translated: If one were to take a razor-edged wheel and move it over his body, severing limbs and extremities, there would be no evil as a consequence, no coming of evil.🔽

original: Dakkhiṇañcepi gaṅgāya tīraṁ gaccheyya hananto ghātento chindanto chedāpento pacanto pācāpento, natthi tatonidānaṁ pāpaṁ, natthi pāpassa āgamo.

original: Uttarañcepi gaṅgāya tīraṁ gaccheyya dadanto dāpento, yajanto yajāpento, natthi tatonidānaṁ puññaṁ, natthi puññassa āgamo.

original: Dānena damena saṁyamena saccavajjena natthi puññaṁ, natthi puññassa āgamo”ti.

original: Sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.

translated: If you attain concentration of mind there, then you can abandon that uncertainty.

analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati  yvā ayam satthā eva vādī eva diṭṭhi  karotaḥ kārayataḥ chindataḥ chedāpayataḥ pacataḥ pācāpayataḥ socayataḥ socāpayataḥ kilamataḥ
